script:
Alright, buckle up folks! AI's latest social trick is doing laundry! Who knew hiring algorithms would clean up their act? A new study shows AI can help wash away bias in the hiring process. That's right, the robots might just be better at picking who gets hired than humans who come with a truckload of their own biases. Finally, a futuristic twist where machines hire humans—what could possibly go wrong? Imagine getting rejected because a chatbot thinks your resume font screams desperation!

Next, Toyota is throwing shade at itself by going electric. Scrapping their old Prius plans, they're revving up development of new EV batteries. About time the party started, right? Apparently, they're gonna give us 932 miles on one charge by 2027. Tech or sorcery? Either way, Toyota is hoping to convince us they're the new green kings, but we’re still side-eyeing them for taking their sweet time.

That’s your news fix, catch y'all next time when robots take over Tinder profiles!

Who knew hiring algorithms would clean up their act?
A new study shows AI can help wash away bias in the hiring process.

content.name: Robots_Hiring
